headline: Grilled Balsamic and Soy Marinated Flank Steak
description: Soy sauce, balsamic vinaigrette, onion, and garlic combine for a tasty marinade, ideal for flank steak before going on the grill.
name: Grilled Balsamic and Soy Marinated Flank Steak

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk onion, garlic, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, soy sauce, Dijon mustard, rosemary, salt, and pepper together in a mixing bowl.

Put the flank steak in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade into the bag and coat steak with the marinade. Squeeze excess air from the bag and seal. Marinate in the refrigerator at least 30 minutes, up to 2 days.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Remove the flank steak from the marinade and shake to remove excess liquid. Reserve marinade.

Cook steak until firm, hot in the center, and just turning from pink to grey, 6 to 8 minutes per side, brushing occasionally with reserved marinade. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 150 degrees F (65 degrees C). Remove steak to a cutting board and rest meat 5 minutes before slicing thinly across the grain.

review.reviewBody: My husband and I both liked it. He said to add it to the rotation.
Did it as written, let it marinade overnight, and it turned out perfect. Even my wife ate some, and she doesn't like beef.
My husband actually exclaimed after the first bite "wow this one is really good!" I did not have rosemary but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. This one's a keeper!
Really like this. Probably should have marinated it a little bit longer than I did, but the meat was very tasty. Yes, it was a little chewy so next time I will marinate longer. It’s a keeper.

The marinade added wonderful flavor to the steak. It marinated for 6-7 hours.
Our steak took a lot longer to cook than the recipe suggested.
Don't cook a steak to 150 degrees. Ever. But it's a good marinade.
Excellent!!!!all I can say
The Best Marinade. Period.
This is PERFECT, as is!
I did add a piece of minced ginger from my garden. Amazingly tender and that's not easy with flank steak. So good!
This is our new go to marinade for flank steak! Like others we didn’t add salt and instead added a tablespoon of sesame oil. Love love love this recipe, thanks for sharing!

I followed the recipe exactly with one exception. I took the excess marinade and boiled it down for about 5 minutes. Served it as a sauce for the flank steak! A bit vinegar ish but I liked it! Both men at the table said it was delish!
Have made this twice now adhering to recipe. Fantastic - all of my guests have raved about it!
It turned out great. Everyone loved it.

soooooooooo goooooooooooood
making it again : )
Didn’t have any onion at the time so I left it out and the family loved it. Will definitely be adding it to the rotation.

Marinated my flank steak 2 days, turning the Ziploc bag over after the first day. Grilled it to 140 degree internal temperature and then covered it and let stand for 5 minutes. OMGosh is this delicious! Thank you for sharing!!
It tasted like it was marinated in vinegar only. Three of us ate it and all agreed. Would never make a gain
Excellent marinade! I used a couple tablespoons of dried minced onion instead of the 1/2 cup of fresh. Will definitely use this again.
Absolutely fabulous! Followed the recipe as precisely as I ever do (I don’t measure, I eyeball), cooked it over charcoal, and it turned out incredibly delicious. I highly recommend this recipe.
Outstanding taste and tender steak.
The flavors from the marinade were not over-powering but perfectly balanced and wonderful. My hubby thought the cooked marinade was a perfect addition to the steak. Thank You for a keeper!
It was great. I’ll cook it again
We did not care for the balsamic and mustard flavor. Prefer the Flank Steak Willyboy recipe.
Great marinade! I used really good balsamic vinegar. Marinade flank steak over night. It was perfect tastes and tenderness! Thanks!!!
Delicious!

Excellent recipe! I followed the recipe as written, however I doubled it and marinated two large flank steaks. I would recommend marinating it at least 4 hours, preferably more, to get the most of the yummy flavors soaked into the meat.
Delicious and I liked that it didn’t have sugar s in it. Much richer with deep flavors and the rosemary is so good with beef!
Made exactly as written, the only true way to review a recipe. This one is for sure a keeper!
This is the most delicious marinade ever. After 2 hours in the marinade, our flank steak was so flavorful and tender. I will definitely make it again.
Made according to the recipe. It tasted good, but the meat was tough. Wouldn't make again, unless I changed the recipe and can tenderize the meat along with marinating it.
Best marinade I’ve found yet! Only I didn’t use soy sauce because I didn’t have it. Instead of soy sauce I used lemon juice. Amazing!!!
Wow, this was so good! I sliced up a round roast and let it marinate for a few hours. I omitted the salt like other reviewers. I will definitely use this recipe again.

You can also cook it in a black skillet and the oven to finish. Sear in hot oil on medium high for 3-5 minutes per side, depending on thickness. Then, keeping it in the skillet, put into pre-heated oven at 425 degrees for another 3-5 minutes, depending on thickness and how done you want it.

Simple. Economical. Delicious. 

This is how you eat like a king without breaking the bank. Thank you for the recipe.

Wow, this is good! After searching the site, I selected this recipe as I had all the ingredients on hand. I used fresh rosemary. I only had about 5 hours to marinate the steak by the time I came across the recipe, and that was more than enough. The meat was very flavorful on it's own, but I boiled the marinade and drizzled it over the cooked meat for added flavor - yum! Definitely will be making this again!!!
Loved the flavour and texture but my guest found it a bit "chewy". Never the less will make again and marinate a bit longer and grill more slowly.
I was afraid this would be too salty but its not. I really liked this marinade and will definitely use again.

A family favorite! It makes an excellent flank steak (the longer you can marinate it, the better!), but I also use it as a marinade for chicken breasts, steak kebobs (usually sirloin) and pork tenderloin. Sometimes I leave the onions out, but I prefer the flavor with the onions. So yummy! Thanks for a delicious recipe!
Good flavor. Only marinated steak for an hour and it still turned out great. Served with rice and steamed veggies.
From the first bite I was sold. We had to ration out to our guests because everyone wanted more. Next time I will make an extra one.
Turned out great! Lot's of complements.
thoroughly enjoyed!! I'm adding this recipe to my family's favorite beef marinades

I didn't have any Dijon mustard but used some honey mustard I had. I marinaded a flank steak for about 40 hours. The steak was moist and flavorful. The only change I would make is cooking the steak for 4-6 (vice 6-8) minutes/side. I prefer my flank steaks a bit more rare (medium/rare) versus medium.

This was absolutely delicious. Marinated the steak for 3 hours and used fresh rosemary and balsamic vinegar dressing. It was perfect and so tender! I then used the leftover meat for steak tacos the next day and it was also delicious!

This was a very easy and flavorful recipe. Marinaded overnight 
and grilled out on charcoal fire. Made recipe exactly as presented. The steak was delicious. My wife absolutely love the 
flavor and was truly excited about the meal. Served with corn on the cob, sliced tomatoes, and barbecue baked beans. Wow, 
what a summer treat. Thank you for sharing!

I made this exactly as written minus the salt and it was amazing. Everyone loved it. Very tasty. I would marinate next time for even 48 hours ahead to lock in the amazing flavour. The flank steak was very tender. Definitely will make it again.
add a little more salt
Easy & delicious. Our new go-to flank steak recipe!
One of the best steak marinades I ever tried, and so easy!!!
This is just delicious.
This came out so good, way better than I expected. Meat was tender and juicy. I plan on making this again and using it for Fajita's. Wow, super impressed. Great recipe.
This turned out awesome and my family loved it. This is definitely a keeper and will be making it a lot more. I only had time to marinate for 6 hours and it was plenty. Thanks for sharing!
Not afraid of flank steak anymore! Came out tasty and tender after six hours marinating!
Flavor okay but nothing to write home about. Marinated for 24 hours but meat was not as tender as it should be.
Marinated a flank steak overnight for the bbq. Excellent flavor!
Yummy. Did this on a Sirloin tip roast which I marinated for several hours. Will be making again.

FANTASTIC!!!!!got a 2 lb flank steak. 1/3c each oil,balsamic vinegar,low sodium soy sauce. 4 cloves garlic,1 onion. 1Tbsp & 1 tsp Dijon mustard, 1 tsp black pepper. 1tbsp & 1 tsp chopped fresh rosemary. No addtl salt. Marinated 24 hrs. Grilled in cast iron skillet.Amazing
Delicious!!! I never eat steak without steak sauce... except this time! I used a flank steak on the BBQ grill.
I let this steak marinate for two days and this was absolutely delicious. Everyone loved it!

Great marinade! Made it on a whim with a frozen london broil. Marinaded for about 3 hours then broiled on low, flipping every 10 minutes till everything else was done. Will be my #1beef marinade from now on.

Great recipe. Very easy. Followed it exactly as it was written with the only change of white balsamic rather than dark. Cooked it on the rare side as that is how we like it. I found it not too salty at all with the soy. I also heated up the marinade and cooked it down a bit to add as a sauce for the finished meat. This was hit for both my husband and me.

This marinade rocks! I fixed up the marinade exactly as written. Didn't change a thing. Sealed it in a gallon sized freezer bag and let it marinate from a Friday afternoon until Sunday evening. I did grill it about 12 to 15 minutes per side because my steak was about 2lbs and I like it a little less pink than the current photo here. It turned out perfect! This is a keeper! Thanks!

Wow, this was amazing. Marinated it 24 hours and followed recipe. I didn't have a grill though, so I broiled it 2-3 inches from broiler for 10 minutes one side and about 5 the other and though it didn't have the char-grilled taste I would have loved, it was still amazing! I will definitely make this again.
Awesome I used fresh rosemary
Loved this recipe. Only had time to marinade for 30 minutes and it was delicious! Want to try it again with more marinating time. This is a keeper.
Delicious!! I paired this with grilled peppers, zucchini and onion.

We used this recipe exactly as written and it was delicious and easy. We will absolutely use it again! Also, the recipe didn't specify fresh vs dried rosemary. We only had dried so that's what we used in quantity listed and it was great!
The whole family loved it! Great flavor! Can't wait to try it again.

Very good, but still doesn't reach the level of my mother-in-law's, which is the reason for the 4-star rating. I did, however, like the contrast of the balsamic; I think it really stood out in the dish, in a good way. This is easy to throw together and will probably make again. It's a healthier alternative to those flank marinades with brown sugar.

Absolutely outstanding! I had a 2 pound flank steak, so the cooking time was 3 minutes longer for it to come out medium rare. Other than that I used yellow mustard because that was all we had in the house. The flavor was terrific and the smell of the steak, while it was resting, just made my mouth water. Not only will we have this again, we'll try the marinate on some other things as well.

AMAZING! Made exactly as recipe called for. I let it
 marinate for 7 hours and the flavor was delish! The hubby said one of the best steaks he has ever had.
Loved the recipe and didn't change a thing. Will use again going forward.
Used Pomegranate Balsamic Vinegar as it was all I had on hand. Wasn't crazy about the taste of the marinade, but let the steak marinate in the fridge for 2 days. Really like the results.

Really good! steak was tender and flavorful. Was easy to make. Left it in the marinade for three days (not on purpose) Took about 7 minutes a side to grill. Husband also really liked it. Will make again, especially when having company, Made it exactly as written.
This Is the best steak marinade! It also made the steak very tender! Made it for a family supper and everyone raved about it! Will definitely make it again over the summer.
yum
Tender, juicy, easy. What else can I say?

This recipe was awesome and super easy. I marinated a top sirloin overnight and threw it on the charcoal grill. Cooked it med rare. After serving it to guests with corn on the cob and grilled asparagus, everyone thought I was a genius! One friend whispered to me to send the recipe to his wife!! I followed recipe exactly-except for the onions (a guest doesn't like them) and the steak was soooo tender and delicious. Many thanks for posting this.
I went with an overnight marinade, used a press for the garlic and served it with sauteed mushrooms. I might have had the grill a bit hotter than medium. Awesome.

WONDERFUL WONDERFUL WONDERFUL!
Did this exactly as written, marinated for 24 hours and we'll do this again over and over without changing one thing!
Delicious! I used green onion in this marinade. Very nice flavors here. I marinated a London Broil instead of flank and grilled. Everyone loved it!

My husband and daughter gave this a "4". It was simple to put together, but didn't seem to wow anyone. I marinated it for about 4 hours, so there was plenty of time for the marinade to penetrate the meat. Thanks!
Holy cow this is good. I made as written except broiled in the over. Marinated overnight. Everyone, including the teenager kiddos, were in awe.

This is our go-to recipe for flank or skirt steak. I've used it for a one-hour marinade or overnight and we've been happy with the results either way. The intensity of the marinade flavor increases with the time marinated, yet even with an hour long soak, the meat turns out pleasantly flavored with a savory rosemary and garlic essence with a hint of basalmic.
This was a very flavorful marinade. The london broil came out very tender. I didn't add any salt because the soy sauce is salty enough for us. This will definitely be in the rotation!

LOVED THIS! Yes, truly! I used the exact ingredients except went short on the salt, but I didn't need to. I would not cook this meat as written, however, as you can tell by my photo! When cut in thin slices, this meat as rare is perfect! It is a perfect recipe! Thank you so much! This will be a repeat for sure---maybe this week!

item.name: Grilled Balsamic and Soy Marinated Flank Steak
